intro: Myosotis cespitosa f. chino, commonly known as the Chinese Forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a clump-forming habit with basal leaves and produces showy inflorescences in late spring to early summer. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate regions.
